LdIv9Jv4tBpc2sSC22Gt1ee2EVXpMVcdw/m+585qOCSdfqHfxKfV7dImqevQd4kq4LYRVekx
Vx1Hve95SWr0edNv2pajX+g38Wl1ubRJB3A7rLX63IKv9JirjpV43/OS1GhI+ZuHDhUZMG6Q
yLS4g030C/0mPq0OlzbBBo5nq1d4zFUHSrzvealqNKScp3vlb279/L5DIq4pkudwod/Ep1W9
tAnKUe1jrlyo9z0vVQ2HdOjAwolIawYdFjPC6TL7CU+remkTlKz999G6S6q5GMkc7nteqhoO
qb2fw+L2AyRf6NflaDzl0iYozbJp/bvs/mDw0TVzDpywZQ3/aBlHlH9IywezNXDP1ondo461
y0k+RMj1aLyUz+j0yLObiHSTzo9MyH/Dd6r24sQzjiinhkM6WH6R/3inwxkoUd8Xx6PxYGaG
nP5RZvnEHnLCM2+/7dm6cg2H9Fx3mXHTPTceIj2VE2Di71WGDrX1VrlDBf4kI81/39e+Gg4p
eKRwrcGJiRswifcqy2v6zXX3ONyCARXrlL8f38fytWovSBXUckhBy59uvfzOpzJxN5kNlHuV
vX3a3vvdEazMXSOy+7WpLSTata6DW10L9QulpkPKi19xU+5V9uYWuc9+7yCZefnpvWRRiouI
AkKqWfErbvq9yo6VY1955ZhNJPd+xrObfjXFpUQBIdWopBU3Ue9Vtt3AdUGwboDkt4/27JPe
YqIVIdUiZcVNv1dZ5/xZEg2Fr3BG7X6hGw/ZYlpO64dp1V6cDlWjP1/6ipt+r7KiE+aqft6c
D74oJ4SkoUa/Wn3FTb9XGSF1tOXFqr04HapGf76cbjKr3KuMkNBxavTny+kmszkJ9yqTXXJ3
Zd1Fri58SGU5gYJa/flyuclsq7h7lfm8xo6OVsM/X+pNZjeIvFfZD4rZLyDQroZDCrSbzAI1
o7ZDChJvMgvUjC/Cz2jcTWaBmvFFCAmoeYQEGCAkwAAhAQYICTBASIABQgIM/H94PyHDFbYU
KwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==">
</img></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The problem isn't solved yet, because according to the question we also need a list of index keys, where each index key points to the movie. So for example we could get a list of the all the movies with the genre animation. We'll do that now.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [93]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>genlist<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">unique</span><span class="p">(</span>gen.vec.clean<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [94]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>genlist
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'Action'</li>
<li>'Thriller'</li>
<li>'Drama'</li>
<li>'Romance'</li>
<li>'Comedy'</li>
<li>'Crime'</li>
<li>'Biography'</li>
<li>'Horror'</li>
<li>'Mystery'</li>
<li>'Fantasy'</li>
<li>'Family'</li>
<li>'Animation'</li>
<li>'War'</li>
<li>'Musical'</li>
<li>'Adventure'</li>
<li>'History'</li>
<li>'Sport'</li>
<li>'Sci-Fi'</li>
<li>'Music'</li>
<li>'Western'</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can do that using the grep command. For example if we wanted the index of the 13 animation movies, we could do</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [95]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>anim<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">grep</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">'Animation'</span><span class="p">,</span>gen<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [96]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>anim
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>22</li>
<li>48</li>
<li>236</li>
<li>243</li>
<li>506</li>
<li>673</li>
<li>777</li>
<li>940</li>
<li>1956</li>
<li>2379</li>
<li>2520</li>
<li>2610</li>
<li>2990</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's see if we got it right?</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [97]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">print</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="p">[</span>anim<span class="p">,</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre> [1] Collaging Film                                          
 [2] The Oscar Nominated Short Films 2012 Animation          
 [3] The Legend of Ponnivala Death and the Queen             
 [4] The Green Marker Scare                                  
 [5] Bee Wars                                                
 [6] How the Snowman Came Back to Life                       
 [7] Alvin and the Chipmunks Easter Collection               
 [8] The Oscar Nominated Short Films 2013 Animation          
 [9] Deadstar the Movie                                      
[10] Stick 10 Even More Swag The United League of Stereotypes
[11] In Saturns Rings                                        
[12] Megillas Lester                                         
[13] Delhi Safari                                            
3384 Levels: 0 1001 Faces 100 Love 100 Miles from Hell 1010 ... Zubeidaa
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To be honest I hadn't heard of most of them, but I googled them. All of them are animations. So great! It works! But we are not done yet. Let's create a list of all the lists.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [98]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>mlist<span class="o">=</span><span class="kt">list</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>x <span class="kr">in</span> genlist<span class="p">){</span>
    ind<span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">grep</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">,</span>gen<span class="p">)</span>
    mlist<span class="p">[[</span>x<span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">=</span>ind
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>So now we have it, if you wanted a list of all the indexes of say War movies. This is what you would do</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [99]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>mlist<span class="o">$</span>War
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>25</li>
<li>104</li>
<li>170</li>
<li>284</li>
<li>378</li>
<li>1176</li>
<li>1325</li>
<li>1700</li>
<li>1808</li>
<li>2065</li>
<li>2103</li>
<li>2154</li>
<li>2162</li>
<li>2175</li>
<li>2391</li>
<li>2669</li>
<li>2954</li>
<li>2973</li>
<li>2977</li>
<li>3007</li>
<li>3074</li>
<li>3079</li>
<li>3081</li>
<li>3083</li>
<li>3084</li>
<li>3176</li>
<li>3213</li>
<li>3249</li>
<li>3284</li>
<li>3290</li>
<li>3358</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's see which are these</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [100]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">print</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="p">[</span>mlist<span class="o">$</span>War<span class="p">,</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre> [1] Less Lost                          6 Foot Rule                       
 [3] Brothers                           Private Peaceful                  
 [5] Antigone Millennium                Glory                             
 [7] GI Joe Deception                   Resistance Movement               
 [9] Macbeth                            Lost Division                     
[11] Tactical Operations                In Clear Sight                    
[13] Erasure                            The Muselmann                     
[15] Long Forgotten Fields              Undying Dreams                    
[17] Ashoka the Great                   Border                            
[19] Chakravyuh                         Earth                             
[21] Kya Dilli Kya Lahore               Lakshya                           
[23] LOC Kargil                         Madras Cafe                       
[25] Mahabharat                         The Rising Ballad of Mangal Pandey
[27] Alluri Seetharama Raju             Daana Veera Suura Karna           
[29] Karna                              Kurukshetramu                     
[31] Shri Krishnanjaneya Yuddham       
3384 Levels: 0 1001 Faces 100 Love 100 Miles from Hell 1010 ... Zubeidaa
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Method-2:-Using-scan">Method 2: Using scan<a class="anchor-link" href="#Method-2:-Using-scan">¶</a></h3><p>As we already know there are 100 ways of doing the same thing in R, this is another.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [101]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>x<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">" "</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">""</span><span class="p">,</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Genre<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [102]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'Action,Thriller'</li>
<li>'Drama,Romance'</li>
<li>'Comedy,Drama'</li>
<li>'Action,Thriller'</li>
<li>'Comedy,Drama,Romance'</li>
<li>'Comedy,Drama,Romance'</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [103]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>write.table<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"datafile.csv"</span><span class="p">,</span>sep<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">","</span><span class="p">,</span>row.names<span class="o">=</span><span class="bp">F</span><span class="p">,</span>quote<span class="o">=</span><span class="bp">F</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [104]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">scan</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"datafile.csv"</span><span class="p">,</span>what<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">'character'</span><span class="p">,</span>sep<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">','</span><span class="p">,</span> quote<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">NULL</span><span class="p">,</span>skip<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [105]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">unique</span><span class="p">(</span>y<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'Action'</li>
<li>'Thriller'</li>
<li>'Drama'</li>
<li>'Romance'</li>
<li>'Comedy'</li>
<li>'Crime'</li>
<li>'Biography'</li>
<li>'Horror'</li>
<li>'Mystery'</li>
<li>'Fantasy'</li>
<li>'Family'</li>
<li>'Animation'</li>
<li>'War'</li>
<li>'Musical'</li>
<li>'Adventure'</li>
<li>'History'</li>
<li>'Sport'</li>
<li>'Sci-Fi'</li>
<li>'Music'</li>
<li>'Western'</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [106]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>uniqueN<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
20
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [107]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">table</span><span class="p">(</span>y<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre>y
   Action Adventure Animation Biography    Comedy     Crime     Drama    Family 
      355       128        13        53      1246       364      2169       245 
  Fantasy   History    Horror     Music   Musical   Mystery   Romance    Sci-Fi 
       99        62       259        31       125       224       589        40 
    Sport  Thriller       War   Western 
       57       510        31         2 </pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Method-3:-Using-lapply">Method 3: Using lapply<a class="anchor-link" href="#Method-3:-Using-lapply">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [108]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>unigen<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">lapply</span><span class="p">(</span>gen.str<span class="p">,</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">)</span> <span class="kp">unique</span><span class="p">(</span>trimws<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">unlist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">strsplit</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">","</span><span class="p">)))))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [109]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>unigen
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol>
<li><ol class="list-inline">
<li>'Action'</li>
<li>'Thriller'</li>
<li>'Drama'</li>
<li>'Romance'</li>
<li>'Comedy'</li>
<li>'Crime'</li>
<li>'Biography'</li>
<li>'Horror'</li>
<li>'Mystery'</li>
<li>'Fantasy'</li>
<li>'Family'</li>
<li>'Animation'</li>
<li>'War'</li>
<li>'Musical'</li>
<li>'Adventure'</li>
<li>'History'</li>
<li>'Sport'</li>
<li>'Sci-Fi'</li>
<li>'Music'</li>
<li>'Western'</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="3.-Convert-the-required-Data-types">3. Convert the required Data types<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.-Convert-the-required-Data-types">¶</a></h2><p>This is an important step in any analysis. This is one of the first things we do in Data Scrubbing (also called as Data Cleansing). Data Scrubbing is basically cleaning the data, and as I like to call it getting it ready for the main steps, in data analysis. Most of the raw data that we get comes to us in the wrong formats. As you will see below all the variables of our IMDB data are stored as <em>Factors</em>, which is absolutely wrong.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [110]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>str<span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>'data.frame':	3389 obs. of  9 variables:
 $ Plot      : Factor w/ 3383 levels "0","100% Love Balu is a brilliant student and always tops his class. Maha Lakshmi comes from a village and stays in Balu's house to"| __truncated__,..: 1249 1021 2080 3214 318 764 1677 2068 1641 1741 ...
 $ Title     : Factor w/ 3384 levels "0","1001 Faces",..: 2659 2896 1648 2369 2352 2708 2246 2482 223 2779 ...
 $ imdbVotes : Factor w/ 897 levels "","-","0","100",..: 665 112 631 345 353 234 668 355 453 364 ...
 $ Poster    : Factor w/ 1784 levels "0","http://ia.media-imdb.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MDU0NTc4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTA2NjYxOQ@@._V1_SX300.jpg",..: 854 1456 1164 99 935 430 811 1206 1192 1518 ...
 $ imdbRating: Factor w/ 89 levels "","-","0","2.5",..: 67 59 19 53 53 38 27 43 29 35 ...
 $ Genre     : Factor w/ 250 levels "0","Action","Action, Adventure",..: 87 195 124 87 134 134 159 134 195 107 ...
 $ imdbID    : Factor w/ 3384 levels "0","tt0016004",..: 487 610 785 417 411 682 583 1138 695 520 ...
 $ Year      : Factor w/ 90 levels "0","1925","1929",..: 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 ...
 $ Language  : Factor w/ 5 levels "0","English                  ",..: 3 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 ...
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The class of an object in R can be known using the <code>class()</code> function. However for a dataframe, it's much simpler to use the <code>str()</code> function. The R Docs define its working as <em>Compactly display the internal <strong>str</strong>ucture of an R object</em>. Above you can see the class of the variable is given right after the name of the variable.</p>
<p>As we already know there are 100 ways of doing the same thing in R. Another uncluttered way of knowing the class of all variables in a data frame is to use <code>sapply()</code> in conjunction with the <code>class()</code> function, as shown below.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [111]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">sapply</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="p">,</span> <span class="kp">class</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<dl class="dl-horizontal">
<dt>Plot</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>Title</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>imdbVotes</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>Poster</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>imdbRating</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>Genre</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>imdbID</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>Year</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
<dt>Language</dt>
<dd>'factor'</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We will try and change all of them except perhaps Language for which the class of factor is better. We'll convert the <em>Plot</em>, <em>Title</em>, <em>Poster</em>, <em>imdbID</em> and <em>Genre</em> into character variables; <em>imdbVotes</em> and <em>imdbRating</em> as well as <em>Year</em> into numeric. We'll leave the <em>Language</em> as factor but you will see, we'll have to do a bit of processing there as well.</p>
<p>In future I might work on this data again and try to resolve the issue with <em>imdbRating</em>, since no rating can be more than 10, the fist few hundred values are just wrong. Right now, I am going to leave it as it is.</p>
<p>I normally don't like to change the same variable, so I'll create a new variable and change that, which will turn out to be usefull as you will see in a minute.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [112]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdb3<span class="o">=</span>imdb2
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now we will change <em>imdb3</em>. We will also load the <em>lubridate</em> package for date formatting.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [113]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>lubridate<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [114]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Plot<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Plot<span class="p">)</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Title<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Title<span class="p">)</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.numeric</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">))</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Poster<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Poster<span class="p">)</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbRating<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.numeric</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>imdbRating<span class="p">))</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Genre<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Genre<span class="p">)</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbID<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>imdbID<span class="p">)</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="o">=</span>year<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.Date</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">,</span>format<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">'%Y'</span><span class="p">))</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">as.factor</span><span class="p">(</span>trimws<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>Warning message in eval(expr, envir, enclos):
“NAs introduced by coercion”Warning message in eval(expr, envir, enclos):
“NAs introduced by coercion”</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We will deal with the warning after explaining Language and Year variables.</p>
<p>You might be wondering the first seven variables was straightforward but what happened with the last two. Well one simple way of dealing with the Year variable is to convert it to character and then convert it to numeric like this <code>as.numeric(as.character(imdb2$Year))</code>.</p>
<p>But in this data there a few problems.</p>
<p>Let's look at the year data</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [115]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">,</span><span class="m">300</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It's difficult to make sense of so much data. An easy way of understanding what's going on is to use <code>levels()</code> function. We can make use of the fact that it is a factor and look at all the levels that a factor contains. <code>nlevels()</code> gives us the number of levels. Compare it with the earlier value we got from <code>str()</code></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [116]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">nlevels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">levels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">

</div>
</div>

<li>'2014�'</li>
<li>'2015'</li>
<li>'2015�'</li>
<li>'2016'</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [117]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>str<span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre> Factor w/ 90 levels "0","1925","1929",..: 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 81 ...
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see years with weird symbols, these weird symbols probably refer to a hyphen indicating that the entry is actually a TV show. Now the date format is not the ideal format in this situation because a date format requires month and day values as well. So we'll convert it to numeric format. However because of the hyphen we can't directly convert to character to numeric. This is what happens:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [118]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">[</span><span class="m">129</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
1989�2015
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [119]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">as.numeric</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">[</span><span class="m">129</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>Warning message in eval(expr, envir, enclos):
“NAs introduced by coercion”</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre>[1] NA</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Hence our method preserves the first value in this case.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [120]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>year<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.Date</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">[</span><span class="m">129</span><span class="p">],</span>format<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">'%Y'</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
1989
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To keep the hyphens we could also just convert them to character format, but that would limit the functionality, for e.g if we wanted to know the how many years it took a sequel to come out. No numerical operations like addition, subtraction can be performed on charcter data. In an ideal situation we would like to deal with movies and TV shows separately, but if we have to deal with them together it's important that the year when a TV show was launched and the year a movie was released be the same.</p>
<p>Now, one last time compare both imdb2 and imdb3 years.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [121]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">nlevels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">levels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">nlevels</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.factor</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">))</span>
<span class="kp">levels</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.factor</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Year<span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
90
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'0'</li>
<li>'1925'</li>
<li>'1929'</li>
<li>'1931'</li>
<li>'1932'</li>
<li>'1935'</li>
<li>'1937'</li>
<li>'1938'</li>
<li>'1939'</li>
<li>'1940'</li>
<li>'1946'</li>
<li>'1950'</li>
<li>'1954'</li>
<li>'1955'</li>
<li>'1956'</li>
<li>'1957'</li>
<li>'1958'</li>
<li>'1959'</li>
<li>'1960'</li>
<li>'1961'</li>
<li>'1963'</li>
<li>'1966'</li>
<li>'1967'</li>
<li>'1968'</li>
<li>'1969'</li>
<li>'1970'</li>
<li>'1971'</li>
<li>'1972'</li>
<li>'1973'</li>
<li>'1974'</li>
<li>'1975'</li>
<li>'1976'</li>
<li>'1977'</li>
<li>'1978'</li>
<li>'1979'</li>
<li>'1980'</li>
<li>'1981'</li>
<li>'1982'</li>
<li>'1983'</li>
<li>'1984'</li>
<li>'1985'</li>
<li>'1986'</li>
<li>'1986�1991'</li>
<li>'1987'</li>
<li>'1988'</li>
<li>'1989'</li>
<li>'1989�2015'</li>
<li>'1990'</li>
<li>'1991'</li>

<li>'2015�'</li>
<li>'2016'</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
71
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'1925'</li>
<li>'1929'</li>
<li>'1931'</li>
<li>'1932'</li>
<li>'1935'</li>
<li>'1937'</li>
<li>'1938'</li>
<li>'1939'</li>
<li>'1940'</li>
<li>'1946'</li>
<li>'1950'</li>
<li>'1954'</li>
<li>'1955'</li>
<li>'1956'</li>
<li>'1957'</li>

<li>'1960'</li>
<li>'1961'</li>
<li>'1963'</li>
<li>'1966'</li>
<li>'1967'</li>
<li>'1968'</li>
<li>'1969'</li>
<li>'1970'</li>

<li>'1975'</li>
<li>'1976'</li>

<li>'1979'</li>
<li>'1980'</li>
<li>'1981'</li>
<li>'1982'</li>
<li>'1983'</li>
<li>'1984'</li>
<li>'1985'</li>
<li>'1986'</li>
<li>'1987'</li>
<li>'1988'</li>
<li>'1989'</li>
<li>'1990'</li>
<li>'1991'</li>
<li>'1992'</li>
<li>'1993'</li>
<li>'1994'</li>
<li>'1995'</li>
<li>'1996'</li>
<li>'1997'</li>
<li>'1998'</li>
<li>'1999'</li>
<li>'2000'</li>
<li>'2001'</li>
<li>'2002'</li>
<li>'2003'</li>

<li>'2008'</li>
<li>'2009'</li>
<li>'2010'</li>
<li>'2011'</li>
<li>'2012'</li>
<li>'2013'</li>
<li>'2014'</li>
<li>'2015'</li>
<li>'2016'</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now let's go to language</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [122]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">nlevels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">levels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
5
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'0'</li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'English                  '</span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'English                    '</span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'Hindi                    '</span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'Telugu                   '</span></li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Clearly there is a problem here. To solve this we will follow a simple procedure: Factor $\rightarrow$ Character $\rightarrow$ Remove white spaces $\rightarrow$ Factor.</p>
<p>This is before conversion</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [123]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                    </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">English                  </span></li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Notice the extra white space. And this is after conversion.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [124]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">as.factor</span><span class="p">(</span>trimws<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">))))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [125]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">nlevels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">levels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">nlevels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">levels</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
5
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'0'</li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'English                  '</span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'English                    '</span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'Hindi                    '</span></li>
<li><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">'Telugu                   '</span></li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
3
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>'English'</li>
<li>'Hindi'</li>
<li>'Telugu'</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Neat and Clean, as it is supposed to be.</p>
<p>Now lets deal with the earlier warnings. Those were concerning the variables <em>imdbVotes</em> and <em>imdbRating</em>.</p>
<h2 id="4.-Sort-the-genre-by-its-name">4. Sort the genre by its name<a class="anchor-link" href="#4.-Sort-the-genre-by-its-name">¶</a></h2><p>We can sort the imdb database according to genre alphabetically like this...</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [126]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="p">[</span><span class="kp">order</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Genre<span class="p">),</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th></th><th scope="col">Title</th><th scope="col">imdbVotes</th><th scope="col">Poster</th><th scope="col">imdbRating</th><th scope="col">Genre</th><th scope="col">imdbID</th><th scope="col">Year</th><th scope="col">Language</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><th scope="row">135</th><td>Six Gun Women                                                                                   </td><td>2718                                                                                            </td><td>N/A                                                                                             </td><td>87                                                                                              </td><td>Action                                                                                          </td><td>tt4020052                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">229</th><td>2056 Escape from Zombie Island                                                                  </td><td>2592                                                                                            </td><td>N/A                                                                                             </td><td>53                                                                                              </td><td>Action                                                                                          </td><td>tt2545870                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">243</th><td>The Search for Agent Z                                                                          </td><td>2718                                                                                            </td><td>N/A                                                                                             </td><td>87                                                                                              </td><td>Action                                                                                          </td><td>tt2267664                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">300</th><td>The Lackey                                                                                      </td><td>2672                                                                                            </td><td>http://ia.media-imdb.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwODIxNjg4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjgzODIxMDE@._V1_SX300.jpg</td><td>71                                                                                              </td><td>Action                                                                                          </td><td>tt2197884                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">329</th><td>Sacred Assassin                                                                                 </td><td>2718                                                                                            </td><td>N/A                                                                                             </td><td>87                                                                                              </td><td>Action                                                                                          </td><td>tt2508246                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">370</th><td>Lethal Commission                                                                               </td><td>1084                                                                                            </td><td>http://ia.media-imdb.com/images/M/MV5BODUyNDI1NjYwOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDgzMzM2Nw@@._V1_SX300.jpg</td><td>64                                                                                              </td><td>Action                                                                                          </td><td>tt2319919                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="5.-Create-new-variable-whose-values-should-be-square-of-difference-between-imdbrating-and-imdbvotes">5. Create new variable whose values should be square of difference between imdbrating and imdbvotes<a class="anchor-link" href="#5.-Create-new-variable-whose-values-should-be-square-of-difference-between-imdbrating-and-imdbvotes">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Method-1">Method 1<a class="anchor-link" href="#Method-1">¶</a></h3><p>The simplest method of doing this is by using <code>with()</code> function</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [127]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdb4<span class="o">=</span>imdb3
imdb4<span class="o">$</span>SDVR<span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">with</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="p">,(</span>imdbVotes<span class="o">-</span>imdbRating<span class="p">)</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb4<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Method-2">Method 2<a class="anchor-link" href="#Method-2">¶</a></h3><p>Again there are several ways of doing something in R but another of the simplest is by using the <code>mutate()</code> function of the <em>dplyr</em> package.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [128]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>dplyr<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The Plot column has a lot of information therefore we will avoid displaying it for the sake of brevity.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [129]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdb5<span class="o">=</span>mutate<span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="p">,</span>SDVR<span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span>imdbVotes<span class="o">-</span>imdbRating<span class="p">)</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb5<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">

<tbody>

<tr><td>The Perks of Being a Wallflower                                                                 </td><td>1270                                                                                            </td><td>http://ia.media-imdb.com/images/M/MV5BMzIxOTQyODU1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDQ4Mjg4Nw@@._V1_SX300.jpg</td><td>71                                                                                              </td><td>Drama, Romance                                                                                  </td><td>tt1659337                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td><td>1437601                                                                                         </td></tr>

<tr><td>Skyfall                                                                                         </td><td>1807                                                                                            </td><td>http://ia.media-imdb.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyODkzNDgzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDMxMDI4Nw@@._V1_SX300.jpg</td><td>68                                                                                              </td><td>Action, Thriller                                                                                </td><td>tt1074638                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td><td>3024121                                                                                         </td></tr>
<tr><td>Silver Linings Playbook                                                                         </td><td>1828                                                                                            </td><td>http://ia.media-imdb.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2MTI5NzA3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODExNTc0OA@@._V1_SX300.jpg</td><td>68                                                                                              </td><td>Comedy, Drama, Romance                                                                          </td><td>tt1045658                                                                                       </td><td>2012                                                                                            </td><td>English                                                                                         </td><td>3097600                                                                                         </td></tr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="6.-Perform-binning-using-imdbvotes">6. Perform binning using imdbvotes<a class="anchor-link" href="#6.-Perform-binning-using-imdbvotes">¶</a></h2><p>Binning means to divide a numerical variable into categories so that the numeric variable may be used as a categorical variable. As we have already seen its quite trivial to convert a categorical variable into numeric, you follow: Factor $\rightarrow$ Character $\rightarrow$ Numeric. The reason you don't directly convert from factor to numeric is that you don't have direct access to the value of the variable, what you get is the index that points to the value. Converting first to character solves this problem.</p>
<p>Before proceeding let us reiterate basic information again: there are two types of binning:</p>
<ol>
<li>Unsupervised</li>
<li>Supervised</li>
</ol>
<p>Unsupervised is the simple one. It is further divided into two types:</p>
<ol>
<li>Unsupervised<ol>
<li>Equal width bins</li>
<li>Equal frequency bins</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Lets first try to bin it in equal width bins, then into equal frequency.</p>
<p>The total data we have is</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [130]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">length</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
3389
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's divide the data into 10 bins</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [131]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>cutpoints<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">pretty</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">,</span>na.rm<span class="o">=</span><span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">,</span>n<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
imdb3<span class="o">$</span>VB<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">cut</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">,</span>cutpoints<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">summary</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>VB<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<dl class="dl-horizontal">
<dt>(0,2e+04]</dt>
<dd>3291</dd>
<dt>(2e+04,4e+04]</dt>
<dd>33</dd>
<dt>(4e+04,6e+04]</dt>
<dd>6</dd>
<dt>(6e+04,8e+04]</dt>
<dd>1</dd>
<dt>(8e+04,1e+05]</dt>
<dd>0</dd>
<dt>(1e+05,1.2e+05]</dt>
<dd>0</dd>
<dt>(1.2e+05,1.4e+05]</dt>
<dd>0</dd>
<dt>(1.4e+05,1.6e+05]</dt>
<dd>1</dd>
<dt>NA's</dt>
<dd>57</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can outright see there is a problem. If we divide the data into equal width bins starting from,</p>
<ol>
<li>0 to 20,000</li>
<li>20,000 to 40,000 and so on ...</li>
</ol>
<p>the problem is most bins have very less or no data at all. We can visualize this problem by using the <code>hist()</code> function</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [132]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>hist<span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">,</span>breaks<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">

<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Therefore, let's try another approach, Equal Frequency binning. If we divide the data into 3 equal frequency bins, we might have approximately</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [135]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="m">3389</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="m">3</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
1129.66666666667
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>observations in each bin.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [136]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>nb<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">3</span>
cutpoints<span class="o">=</span>quantile<span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">,(</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="o">:</span>nb<span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span>nb<span class="p">,</span>na.rm<span class="o">=</span><span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">)</span>
cutpoints
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">

<dd>157992</dd>

</pre></div>

</img></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This wasn't exactly equal frequency, the middle column has more and the last has less. Turns out the value 2718 is repeated alot and therefore we can't have more than 3 cuts in the data as well because this happens:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [140]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>nb<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">4</span>
cutpoints<span class="o">=</span>quantile<span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">,(</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="o">:</span>nb<span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span>nb<span class="p">,</span>na.rm<span class="o">=</span><span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">)</span>
cutpoints
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<dl class="dl-horizontal">
<dt>0%</dt>
<dd>5</dd>
<dt>25%</dt>
<dd>1965.25</dd>
<dt>50%</dt>
<dd>2718</dd>
<dt>75%</dt>
<dd>2718</dd>
<dt>100%</dt>
<dd>157992</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [141]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>VB1<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">cut</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">,</span>cutpoints<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_text output_error">
<pre>
Error in cut.default(imdb3$imdbVotes, cutpoints): 'breaks' are not unique
Traceback:

1. cut(imdb3$imdbVotes, cutpoints)
2. cut.default(imdb3$imdbVotes, cutpoints)
3. stop("'breaks' are not unique")</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>You get an error because, the data cannot be divided twice using the same cutpoint. Similarly,</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [142]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>nb<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">10</span>
cutpoints<span class="o">=</span>quantile<span class="p">(</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>imdbVotes<span class="p">,(</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="o">:</span>nb<span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span>nb<span class="p">,</span>na.rm<span class="o">=</span><span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">)</span>
cutpoints
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<dl class="dl-horizontal">
<dt>0%</dt>
<dd>5</dd>
<dt>10%</dt>
<dd>1337.4</dd>
<dt>20%</dt>
<dd>1798</dd>
<dt>30%</dt>
<dd>2173.3</dd>
<dt>40%</dt>
<dd>2592</dd>
<dt>50%</dt>
<dd>2718</dd>
<dt>60%</dt>
<dd>2718</dd>
<dt>70%</dt>
<dd>2718</dd>
<dt>80%</dt>
<dd>2718</dd>
<dt>90%</dt>
<dd>2718</dd>
<dt>100%</dt>
<dd>157992</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="7.-Remove-the-leading-and-trailing-spaces-from-Variable-“Language”">7. Remove the leading and trailing spaces from Variable “Language”<a class="anchor-link" href="#7.-Remove-the-leading-and-trailing-spaces-from-Variable-“Language”">¶</a></h2><p>We already solved this problem when we converted the formats, using:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [143]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">as.factor</span><span class="p">(</span>trimws<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdb2<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">))))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
<li>English</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="8.-Extract-Telugu-movies-data.-Subset-the-data-using-variable-“Language”">8. Extract Telugu movies data. Subset the data using variable “Language”<a class="anchor-link" href="#8.-Extract-Telugu-movies-data.-Subset-the-data-using-variable-“Language”">¶</a></h2><p><em>-1</em> in the funciton below is to avoid displaying the plot column which is too long to display. And our database has 188 Telugu movies.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [144]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdbtel<span class="o">=</span>imdb3<span class="p">[</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="o">==</span><span class="s">"Telugu"</span><span class="p">,]</span>
<span class="kp">nrow</span><span class="p">(</span>imdbtel<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdbtel<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

<h2 id="9.-Replace-the-word-English-with-Hindi-in-the-variable-“Language”">9. Replace the word English with Hindi in the variable “Language”<a class="anchor-link" href="#9.-Replace-the-word-English-with-Hindi-in-the-variable-“Language”">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [145]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>imdbhindi<span class="o">=</span>imdb3
imdbhindi<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"English"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"Hindi"</span><span class="p">,</span>imdb3<span class="o">$</span>Language<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [146]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>imdbhindi<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="10.-Create-a-vector-using-rep-command-where-there-are-10-occurrences-of-4,-20-occurrences-of-5-and-30-occurrences-of-6.-Count-should-be-60">10. Create a vector using rep command where there are 10 occurrences of 4, 20 occurrences of 5 and 30 occurrences of 6. Count should be 60<a class="anchor-link" href="#10.-Create-a-vector-using-rep-command-where-there-are-10-occurrences-of-4,-20-occurrences-of-5-and-30-occurrences-of-6.-Count-should-be-60">¶</a></h2><p>This is a really simple problem. Doable by one rep command.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [147]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>repvec<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">rep</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">6</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">20</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">30</span><span class="p">))</span>
repvec
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<p>We'll check whether we got it right.</p>
